definitions.definition: To constitute in parts, each having a special function, act, office, or relation; to systematize.
To furnish with organs; to give an organic structure to; to endow with capacity for the functions of life
labels: chiefly used in the past participle
definitions.label_groups: transitive , chiefly used in the past participle

definitions.definition: To band together into a group or union that can bargain and act collectively; to unionize .
examples: the workers decided to organize ; their next task was to organize the workers at the steel mill

main_definition: ( transitive ) To arrange in working order .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To constitute in parts, each having a special function, act, office, or relation; to systematize.
( transitive , chiefly used in the past participle ) To furnish with organs; to give an organic structure to; to endow with capacity for the functions of life
( transitive , music ) To sing in parts.
( transitive , intransitive ) To band together into a group or union that can bargain and act collectively; to unionize .
